catchphrase: We're excited to bring HalfStack back to Newquay on the 23rd of June, 2023
description: 100-125 Front-end / Web / JavaScript / Mobile / IoT developers and decision makers
Mostly from the Southwest UK, with some from through the UK, Europe and beyond
layoffs: We are saddened to see so many of our fellow developers and designers affected by the recent tech layoffs, which is why we want to do something to help. If you’ve been laid off recently, get in touch and we’ll give you a ticket on the house! Your next opportunity could be waiting for you in Newquay.
schedule: HalfStack starts around 10am, includes approximately 8-10 sessions, breaks, lunch, dinner, and an interactive afterparty. Plan to arrive by 10am and stay late! We're also expecting to have fun at the beach on Saturday, so plan to stay the whole weekend! Sessions will be announced closer to the event.

description: Earth to Abigail and Otto will use live coding to create music with the audience
sessions.title: To Be Revealed (Live Music Coding)

description: AI is currently being heralded as the next evolution in computing and people are worried if their jobs are safe. They are not. A lot of the things we are being paid for now can be done by machines. The question is if that should come as a surprise, or if this is an opportunity to scrutinise if what we do is actually not necessary? AI is a tool and it is here to stay. It is now up to us to make it work for us and teach the next generation of creators what's good and not what's *good enough*.
sessions.title: Turning the screw with AI

description: Five years ago HalfStack legend Tony Edwards regaled us with a look at using JS to transcribe his live rapping. Much has improved so we'll look at the current state of transcribing audio to text with JS and AI.
sessions.title: Five years later: The state of Audio to Text in JS with AI

description: Shelly will share some of the fun web audio projects she's been working on recently.
sessions.title: To Be Revealed (Web Audio Experiments)
Recent Adventures in Building 3D things on the Web

description: a.k.a How to be a sustainable web developer
sessions.title: Saving the planet, one website at a time

sessions.by: Earth to Abigail and Shelly Knotts
description: Estuary is a live coding platform for making music and visualizations. We'll get a quick intro to the platform and then use it to create music together during the afterparty!
sessions.title: Introduction to Estuary

description: Want to share something you've been working on lately? Spend 2-3 minutes on stage sharing your project! First-come, first-served sign-ups on the day of the event.
sessions.title: Lightning Talks

description: We will kick off the afterparty with Battledecks, a tech improv game. You have 5 minutes to pitch a fake tech startup from a randomly generated slide deck. Then we'll proceed in teams with our unique JS Pub Quiz!
sessions.title: Afterparty (JS Pub Quiz and Battledecks)

sessions.by: Earth to Abigail and Shelly Knotts
description: A live coding performance with audience participation encouraged!
sessions.title: Afterparty Live Coding Performance
